column4: haha. i love how in Ubuntu there's a 30% chance windows you select just won't open, like FF or a terminal
people can read, if anyone could help they'd jump in
is your question how to install grub from Live CD?
this might help you: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=224351 Just remember that it is now "find /boot/grub/menu.lst"
there may be a better automatic way of doing it, but i am also very new to ubuntu
I'm not an idiot. Ubuntu simply failed to give me a GRUB install
I probably missed a checkbnox which said 'Make Ubuntu actually work'
sorry i do not follow... you do cannot run grub from live cd?
Fresh install of Ubuntu failed to give me GRUB
you mean it did not make the /boot/grub directory?
that it very strange. however, i believe you still can create the /boot/menu.lst file yourself - and install grub to the MBR of (hd0) from the live cd by running it from there.
yeah, I tried. then I ran into errors.
once you boot into your ubuntu installation, you might then (re)install grub
errors. I'm sick of explaining everything a million times. I'll let you know how the reinstall goes. oh wait, it takes two hours.
strange again, for me it took around 14 minutes. however chances are good that reinstalling it from the same source won't help - unless u messed some configuration the first time.
